intro: Loxodera ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. Loxodera ledermannii typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
